name: Healthcheck
short_description:
Healthcheck is a tool for checking remote servers if everything is ok, and if not to run the appropriate commands there to fix things.

It provides multiple level of notifications, and multiple fix actions for every level.

You may ask why an other one as there are already many similar and very good ones. Well it was something I have to do, and decide it to publish it.

The second reason is that all these packages are promising "simple usage" but guess what, they are lying ! You need hordes of Linux administrators to prepare the web servers, databases, frameworks etc ... to make them just install themselves. 
To make them also do something useful this is a different story !!

Healthcheck is actually a script. Change the config file to your needs and start it. Thats it.

Many thanks to Mario Roy
https://code.google.com/p/many-core-engine-perl/
for his his excellent MCE module where all the parallelization is depend on

George Mpouras
summary: Monitor remote linux servers and automatic fix problems
